Eric Schmidt 's departure had been a long time coming, says Charles Arthur in The Guardian: After slipups with search, Street View and Android, it's clear that Google needs tighter control at the top- and Eric Schmidt is not the man for the job. What of Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin ? He is said to be focusing on strategic projects and is particularly interested in social networking. That doesn't mean Eric Schmidt is leaving-- he'll carry on as Executive Chairman and serve as an advisor to Page and co-founder Sergey Brin , focused on external things like deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership. As for Sergey Brin , he'll now "devote his energy to strategic projects, in particular working on new products," with the simple title of Co-Founder.
